name: Puzzled.by
tag_list: community, opinions, crowdsourcing, social, decisions, qa, questions
overview:
Puzzled.by is a community where people share opinions in both a quantitative and qualitative way.

Puzzled.by lets people ask quantitative questions and answer them. They are building a community that helps startups, SMEs, or regular users make better decisions on a daily basis, whether they are testing an idea, need advice on which logo to choose, what to wear/cook on a special night, or just want to hear the crowd opinion on a a curiosity they’ve always had “Do you believe aliens exist?” “Are you pro/con gay marriage?” “Would you buy the new iWatch?”.

Puzzled.by is crowdsourcing opinions and they are also making it fun for people to contribute!

They keep records of every question submitted, so soon enough we will be able to access a database of curiosities, opinions and decisions around the world to help us with our own decisions or just to provide an fun and informative browsing session.

Through their FB login system and their signup procedure they also have good demographics of their userbase which allows them to display filtered results of any question based on a user’s desired target market.

Puzzled.by is changing the belief that market research questions are dull and always come from companies, they let the people ask the questions and also allow them to share publicly and openly their opinion. It needs to be mentioned that user can choose to be anonymous when answering questions so that there are no privacy issues.

Puzzled.by builds on users’ intrinsic motivation and natural curiosity for human knowledge and offers an overall nice gamified experience to their users, not to mention a lot of interesting facts about people, their friends and their opinions.

Puzzled.by is an interesting, possible disruptive concept which deserves a try.
